content:
Calculate the perimeter of a square
Side length 10

To calculate the perimeter of a square, you can use the formula:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 4 \times \text{side length} \]

Given that the side length of the square is 10, the perimeter would be:

\[ \text{Perimeter} = 4 \times 10 = 40 \]

So, the perimeter of the square is 40 units.
